required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Rigid and Non-Rigid Interbody Fusion Device for Cervical Degenerative Disc Disease in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Rigid and Non-Rigid Interbody Fusion Device for Cervical Degenerative Disc Disease in Adults - A Randomized, Prospective, Multicenter Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Rigid interbody fusion device in bulk configuration has been widely used in anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF) surgery. It is a randomized, prospective, multicenter clinical study to compare rigid and non-rigid fusion device in ACDF for cervical degenerative disc disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized, prospective, multicenter clinical trial comparing rigid (PEEK) interbody fusion device with non-rigid (Titanium Alloy, Z-Brace, Baui Biotech) interbody fusion device in ACDF surgery at 11 clinical sites. ACDF was performed with stand-alone interbody fusion device and artificial bone graft (hydroxyapatite/tricalcium phosphate). Patients have 1-level or 2-level cervical degenerative disc disease approved for ACDF surgery by National Health Insurance, which is the blind, third-party, administrative approved and insurance reimbursement for surgical indication. Total 180 patients were enrolled, and 180 patients were randomized into either investigational device (non-rigid) group or the control (rigid) group in a 2:1 ratio. After confirming a patient's eligibility and having the patient sign an informed consent form, the site investigator or study coordinator call the coordinator at National Taiwan University Hospital for the randomization. Each patient will be then assigned to 1 of the treatment group according to a randomized schedule. Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively. Measured outcomes included overall success, Neck Disability Index (NDI), VAS neck and arm pain, adjacent range of motion, patient satisfaction, anxiety score, SF-12 MCS/PCS, major complications, subsequent surgery rate, and subsidence and fusion rate on radiological examinations. The primary endpoint was a FDA composite definition of success comprising clinical improvement and absence of major complications and secondary surgery events.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Total 180 patients were enrolled, and 180 patients were randomized into either investigational device (non-rigid) group or the control (rigid) group in a 2:1 ratio.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline postoperative condition (if patients have major complications)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: No adverse events (AEs) classified as major complications by Research Ethics Committee.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline postoperative condition (if patients have subsequent surgeries)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Subsidence and Fusion rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: Subsidence and fusion rate on radiological.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Adjacent range of motion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: Adjacent range of motion on radiological.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Neck Disability Index (NDI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: An improvement in Neck Disability Index (NDI) score of at least 30 points for a patient with a preoperative NDI score of 60 or greater; or an improvement of at least 50% of preoperative NDI score for patients with a preoperative score of less than 60.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scale (neck and arm and chest pain)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient will be evaluated by Visual analogue scale(VAS) for their neck, arm and chest pain. The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is 10. Higher score means a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be surveyed by Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire. There are two questions on the questionnaire to evaluate if they are satisfied with their treatment and if they will recommend their respective surgery to a friend.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: The Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI). The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is 63. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Short form-12 mental component scale and physical component scale (SF-12 MCS/PCS) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Short form-12 mental component scale and physical component scale. The minimum value of physical component scale (PCS-12) is 18.4 and the maximum value of PCS-12 is 57.8. The minimum value of mental component scale (MCS-12) is 18.7 and the maximum value of MCS-12 is 65.2. Higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days using Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory analgesics(NSAIDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days using Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory analgesics(NSAIDs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient were evaluated preoperatively, one month postoperatively, and 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Beck Depression Inventory(BDI). The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is 63. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Use non-rigid (Titanium Alloy, Z-Brace, Baui Biotech) interbody fusion device.

intervention.description: Use non-rigid (Titanium Alloy, Z-Brace, Baui Biotech) interbody fusion device in Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion (ACDF) surgery
Use rigid (PEEK) interbody fusion device in Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion (ACDF) surgery

Taipei Medical University-Shuang Ho Hospital,Ministry of Health and Welfare
National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu Branch
